column4: howdy... new to ubuntu..  does ubuntu have a default root pw?  i dont recall setting one
there is a root, just his password isn't set
your current user can use sudo to do anything root can do, you just need to type in your current user's password when asked
su - ?
http://www.ubuntu.com/support/documentation/faq/root
tx
no, sudo
nate... tx.
np
sudo -u root passwd
why even bother setting a pword?
im a noob to ubuntu, but pretty good with linux.
heard about it alot, wanted to give it a shot
sudo allows you to do anything root can do from your current login
without su
and if you need a terminal as root, you can type in: sudo -s
all using your own password
im just trying to update my install
sudo can do that :)
wow... much different then what i am used to
what, the fact that it actually works, and not slowly?
